meanings.definition: A person who rejects or disavows a belief or doctrine.
meanings.sent1: The repudiationists in the group disagreed with the new rule.
meanings.sent2: The repudiationists at the meeting refused to sign the agreement.
meanings.sent3: The repudiationists jokingly declared that they were on a 'belief strike'.
meanings.sent4: The repudiationists stood out like lone wolves in the sea of agreement.
meanings.sent5: The image of the repudiationists tearing up the doctrine was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Those who refuse to accept or acknowledge something.
meanings.sent1: Despite the evidence, the repudiationists remained steadfast in their denial.
meanings.sent2: The repudiationists ignored the facts presented to them.
meanings.sent3: The repudiationists pretended not to see the giant elephant in the room.
meanings.sent4: The repudiationists were like stubborn rocks, unmoved by reason.
meanings.sent5: The image of the repudiationists covering their ears to block out the truth was striking.
